name: Port Toddy
description: A port toddy is one of winter’s unsung delights. Replacing whiskey with port in a toddy leads to something surprising and special. Somehow, it feels more curative than one with harder spirits: it’s like the alcohol-fortified equivalent of a bowl of homemade chicken soup. This requires a ruby port, which is the cheapest and most easily found. (The New York Times)
recipeIngredient: 3 ounces ruby port (I like Fonseca or Taylor Fladgate, either of which would be good for the punch)
1 1-inch-wide ribbon of orange peel studded with 3-5 cloves.

recipeInstructions.text: In a mug or heatproof glass, stir the port, sugar and juices together with the cinnamon stick, leaving the cinnamon in the vessel. Add hot water to fill, and garnish with the clove-studded orange peel.
